title: For French universities, international students are a form of political, scientific and economic soft power
summary: The presence of international students in France has pushed higher education institutions to innovate and rethink their courses. But they also reinforce the country's soft power and provide an economic windfall.

title: Macron reiterates ground operation in Ukraine possible 'at some point'
summary: Days after meeting with German and Polish leaders in Berlin, the French president told 'Le Parisien' that he would not initiate ground operations in Ukraine.

title: In Tigray, Ethiopian women face horrific choice: 'To die or to be raped'
summary: Aid organizations have estimated that 15% of women contracted HIV during the civil war against the region's rebels and its occupation.

title: DignifAI: Internet users dress women using artificial intelligence
summary: AI tools are being used to modify images of women deemed 'depraved,' adding clothes and, in some cases, White children and husbands.

title: Amazonian Jews feel abandoned
summary: This Brazilian Jewish community of 5,000 people has experienced antisemitism since the start of the war in Gaza between Israel and Hamas.

title: Six Nations: France defeats England to secure second place
summary: France ended their Six Nations campaign with a 33-31 victory over England in Lyon on Saturday after Ireland lifted the title by beating Scotland earlier in the day.

title: Pegasus affair in Poland: Jaroslaw Kaczynski criticizes 'an imaginary reality'
summary: After an eight-hour hearing on Friday, marked by disorder, Poland's former strongman failed to provide investigators with any new information, opting instead for a strategy of denial and obstruction.

title: Left-wing MP François Ruffin: 'Macron's zigzags on Ukraine are losing the French and our allies'
summary: As France's radical left La France Insoumise party officially launches its campaign for the European elections on Saturday at a rally in Villepinte, the LFI MP looks back at why he voted against the Franco-Ukrainian agreement.

title: Ireland retains Six Nations title after beating Scotland
summary: Tries by Dan Sheehan and Andrew Porter got the Irish over the line (17-13) as the hosts were thwarted time and again by a magnificent Scottish defense.

title: Suspect in triple murder captured in New Jersey after multi-state manhunt
summary: A man suspected of killing three family members in their Philadelphia-area homes Saturday was arrested in New Jersey after evading law enforcement for hours as police mobilized across two states.

title: Men raped by women: A taboo that calls gender stereotypes into question
summary: In the wake of France's #MeTooGarcons movement, three men have agreed to testify to the violence they have suffered at the hands of women.

title: India to hold national election over six weeks starting April 19
summary: The country's electoral commission announced Saturday that voting would take place between April 19 and June 1. Almost a billion Indians are eligible to vote.

title: Cyprus says second aid ship ready to leave for Gaza
summary: A maritime aid corridor from Cyprus is meant to at least partly address stark shortages in Gaza after more than five months of war.

title: Gaza: Israeli army again denies having opened fire on crowds queuing for aid, killing twenty people
summary: Gazan civilians were killed on a traffic circle on Thursday evening as they waited for trucks loaded with food. According to a Palestinian journalist present at the scene, Israeli forces opened fire on the crowd.

title: Olympics controversy: 'The choice of Nakamura to represent France raises political issues that go beyond just her'
summary: According to sociologists Karim Hammou and Marie Sonnette-Manouguian, Macron's choice 'seems to be part of a desire to erase the right-wing, racist image of recent government policies'.

title: Ukrainian strikes rock Russia as vote cements Putin's grip on power
summary: This past week saw an increase in fatal Ukrainian aerial attacks and a series of incursions into Russian territory by pro-Ukrainian sabotage groups.

title: Why are we so behind on male contraception?
summary: Birth control was one of the greatest medical advancements of the 20th century, yet the vast majority of contraceptives are still intended for women only.

title: Cockfighting is on the decline in Northern France
summary: Out of step with the times, the breeding of these roosters is finding less fans among young people, and is critized by animal rights activists.
